page.title: 07TOFT HILL HALL FARM(CONT)
page.content: bale grab, silage fork, a grass cutter, a fertilizer spreader and an assortment of trailers. The main purpose of the farm is the production of cattle and sheep for sale at the local market, to which they go regularly in the late summer and early autumn. The weather in the summer of 1985 has caused severe problems on the farm. Rain and high winds from a constant flow of low pressure areas from the Atlantic Ocean has severely hampered the collection of the hay crop. As a result the majority of the grass crop has been collected as silage. On a brighter note Saturday September 14th. saw the marriage of the elder son Graeme who will now live and work on the farm.
